quest.name: Reassuring the Masses
journal: The manager of suites seems surprised to see you up and about.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Oh, misssir, you're awake!

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: You were injured during the foray on Mt. Gulg, yes? I was here at my station, as always, when they carried you in on a makeshift stretcher looking disturbingly bereft of vigor...

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: And to compound my worry, the sky has...well, I'm sure you've seen. It has everyone rather concerned, to say the least.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Seeing you up and about is the first good news we've had in a while. Assuming you feel strong enough, would you mayhap consider a stroll around the city to reassure our anxious citizens?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Bragi was one of those who helped convey you to your chambers, and he has visited several times since to inquire after your condition...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Well, well, look who's back from the dead!

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Aye, it was a grim sight. Your companions looked fair ready to drop when they brought you in, so I offered a helping hand. Couldn't bear to see them struggle so...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: And you, my friend, I feared you had one foot in the grave. Cold and lifeless, you were, like a corpse that was somehow still breathing.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Then they told me some evil bastard went and snatched our poor Exarch away in the midst of the chaos. Wicked white, what is this world coming to...?

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...Bah, but moaning never solved a thing, did it? Nay, it's times like these that we Crystarium folk stand tall and do what needs to be done.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Trade with Eulmore is back on the table. We'd best make use of those resources to fortify the city against the eaters─or whatever misery the fates deem fit to throw at us next.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...Speaking of misery, Chessamile was worried sick about you. A healer wringing her hands is not a sight you ever wish to see, let me tell you...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Full glad I am to see you walking again, my friend. But this business with the Exarch...it weighs heavily upon all our minds.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Oh! Oh, sweetie, you're alive!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: No one's been allowed to see you─even Spagyrics chirurgeons were forbidden from making visits...

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Ryne was kind enough to tell me you were showing symptoms similar to eater corruption─so I suppose there was little any of us could have done for you in any case.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: As for your companions, they've been rushing hither and yon, seeking a cure to your condition. I worry to see their faces grown ever more haggard every time they pass through the Crystarium...

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: I shall let them know you're awake. And when they come to see you, sweetie, please do convince them to rest a bit─they won't be helping anyone if they all collapse of exhaustion.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Ah, and our own Moren has been little better, I'm afraid. He hasn't left the Cabinet, too busy with his nose buried in one dusty tome or another...

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: I wish I could brew you a tonic, sweetie, but I've no idea how it might affect you...

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: ...No, it's too dangerous. In the end, I can but pray for your well-being. May blessed shadow keep you, your friends, and the Exarch as well.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Confound it, this says the same thing as the last! Mayhap I should approach the problem from a different perspective...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Forename! Is it truly you and not some figment of my imagination!?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Oh, but this is wonderful! 'Twould seem our prayers have been answered!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Feeling otherwise helpless, I've been scouring our shelves for the wisdom to explain this most worrisome conundrum: why, with all the Lightwardens defeated, has the Light returned to obscure the sky?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: I must have pored over a hundred tomes, but no definitive conclusion seems forthcoming. So many questions I would pose to the Exarch...and thus do I feel his absence all the more keenly.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Now that you are awake, however, I am hopeful the search for our stolen steward might begin in earnest.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Katliss, meanwhile, leads the Crystalline Mean in preparations for battle...though against what foe, we are as yet uncertain. Why not pay her a visit? I expect seeing you upright would be a much-welcome relief!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: I shall forge ahead with my search for answers. I'll not have it said that I abandoned my efforts at the first sign of hardship!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Forename! Alive and well, I see!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: You gave us all a proper fright, you know that? The friends you've made in the facets have been talking with me, wondering what they could do to help...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: You gave us all a proper fright, you know that? Not a day's gone by that I haven't heard folk worrying what's to become of you or the Exarch...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text:
Anyway, I'm glad you've recovered enough to stand.
...You're not planning on striking out straightaway, though, are you? I was hoping to have a better look at your equipment...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: If we'd been able to provide you with better weapons or sturdier helms...then maybe you would have won the day, and the Exarch would still be here.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: As such, we're keeping busy consulting each other on new forging techniques and designs and the like. If you could stand still a moment, I'd like to assess the gear we're trying to improve...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Aye, well... That's some fine work, I must admit.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: It wouldn't be impossible to make something better, but we'd need to experiment with different patterns and materials. And I'm not sure we have that kind of time...

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: (-???-)That sounds like a challenge that he would enjoy.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Greetings, Glynard. The master of the Stairs is running his own errands now, is he?

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Aye, well, my servers are distraught enough as it is, and I didn't want to crack the whip too hard.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: But never mind that. I'm thinking our absent genius and his epiphanies are the perfect answer to this predicament of yours.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: And by “genius,” you mean old Grenoldt? He is a man of unrivaled gifts, I won't argue with you there.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: But what good does his talent do us if we can't bloody find him? No one's seen hide nor hair of Grenoldt since he wandered off some years ago.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: You know what he's like once he latches onto an idea─he's probably cloistered himself in some forgotten cave, completely absorbed in his latest creation. I wouldn't even know where to start looking...

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: ...That does make things difficult.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Still, if that eccentric is someone you're destined to meet, I wager he'll show up soon enough.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: In my time at the bar, many's the tale I've heard told of strangely fated encounters─even if a few of them might be stretching the truth just a bit.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: We'll keep our noses to the grindstone for the time being. But on the off chance you do encounter Grenoldt, you'd be wise to take advantage of his brilliance rather than wait on our slow-and-steady progress.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: This is all talk for when you're fully recovered, of course. I'll let you get back to convalescing, eh?

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Ah, before you do that... You're actually the reason I came over here in the first place.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: I don't suggest partaking of my stock until you're properly well, but if you're passing near the Stairs, then I've a regular who's eager to see you.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: I don't suggest partaking of my stock until you're properly well, but if you're passing near the Stairs, then I've a few regulars I'd like to introduce you to.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: I'd best be getting back. Just because the world's coming apart at the seams doesn't mean we have to follow suit now, does it?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Hear, hear. We can't forget the heart upon which this city was founded, or the Exarch might not have much of a home to return to.
